content: Ok someone approved this PR... now whose turn is it to merge it?
@Simon Hudon how does the new PR review system work?
If @Chris Hughes is assigned to it and that he approves, he can merge it. If he's not sure about anything, he can invite someone else to review (not necessarily maintainers).
Okay, I'll merge it. I wasn't sure how the PR system works either.
No trouble! Maybe I should work out some documentation

I guess we still need to figure out how we want to handle it in the end. But small PRs like #666 should be no problem. For bigger ones it is good to wait a while until everybody had the time to see it and comment

I must say that I don't really like this "timeout" approach. I'd rather we invite people to comment (as reviewers or assignees) and get them to say "I don't mind" or "I like it" instead of assuming that people with pertinent expertise agree if they don't say anything
If the most relevant person has already approved, is it reasonable to assign a PR to one of the mainainers? Or is it better to leave it as is?
I don't think you'll be able to make the assignment but bringing it to the attention of a maintainer should let them either make the assignment or merge
Kenny's been assigning me to all his PRs.
Yes, it seems I can assign, too. I've been requesting reviews, however, as that seems politer. :-)
